`pandas` is used throughout, but is not explicitly a dependency. Have raised to upstream to see if it can be added as a dependency there.

xref: https://github.com/bokeh/bkcharts/issues/72

So this is a can of worms. `bokeh` requires `bkcharts`, but `bkcharts` uses `bokeh` throughout. Thus import tests fail without `bokeh`. It seems like `bokeh` will drop `bkcharts` in the long term. Would expect `bkcharts` also starts depending on `bokeh` then. In the interim, this helps us avoid a painful cyclic dependency.

Also it seems this won't work with the current `bokeh` in `conda-forge` (0.12.5). So am pinning `bokeh` to 0.12.6.

xref: https://github.com/bokeh/bkcharts/issues/73
